messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group of 16 scholars. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, and Reza. Wim is connected to Amir, Raj, Jing, and Eva. Raj is connected to Amir, Wim, Jing, and Wei. Jing is also connected to Amir, Wim, Raj, and Pam. Wei is connected to Nisha, Reza, Kim, and Raj. Nisha is connected to Wei, Reza, Kim, and Sara. Reza is connected to Amir, Kim, Nisha, and Wei. Kim is also connected to Wei, Nisha, Reza, and Moin. Ian is connected to Moin, Puja, Sara, and Matt. Moin is connected to Ian, Puja, Kim, and Sara. Puja is connected to Pari, Ian, Sara, and Moin. Sara is also connected to Ian, Moin, Puja, and Nisha. Pari is connected to Pam, Matt, Eva, and Puja. Pam is connected to Jing, Pari, Matt, and Eva. Matt is connected to Pari, Pam, Eva, and Ian. Eva is also connected to Pari, Pam, Matt, and Wim. You have been told that Moin is donating 50 books and Matt is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

Answer:,A,P,M,P,A,S,E,W,R,R,J,N,Y,F,K,K,D,N,P,D,J,B,D,P,L,L
You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: (.+) *([A-Za-z ]+)+'
user: You have taken the last train from Trivandrum to Kochi. You had some tickets that cost 10 INR and some tickets that cost 25 INR. You spent all your money on tickets. There is a single conductor who checks ticket on the train. He can check twice or thrice. However, the conductor must check that you bought at least 10 INR ticket. Now, please write the function that will ask for all your tickets, but return a boolean value `true` if you have spent 10 INR and the function returns `false` if there are tickets left to take.
user: A group of 15 friends went to the cinema. They sat in three blocks consisting of five seats each. Amina has to change seats because she spilled coffee on her pants. So, she has only three options (B, C & D). Now you have to write a method that will accept a pair (A,A) and return the seats that won't change. Answer:B,D,
You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'answer: .* \d+,0'
user: A group of 15 students is going to sit in one of the 3 different classes. You are an instructor of one of these classes. Now you have to assign the students to a right class and write their final outcomes as string. It is necessary that you will use different classes. For example, you have to use 2 different classes, 3 different classes or 7 different classes. If your classes are A and B, the solution should be abaaabbaa.... etc. The answer: abbcabcabcabcabcabcaa...
user: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will

You are told that Amir and Reza had a disagreement and are no longer connected. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

user: A group of 200 parents is moving to a new city. In the new city the parents want to choose the school for their children at the maximum 1 km distance. The distance can be more than 1km but less than 3 km, so you should return all the possible pairs of schools. You have also an extra rule. The school that is in the center is not allowed in the final result. If the group is 10 parents then the answer should be like { A, B} where A-center. If the group is 150 parents then the answer should be like {A,B,C,D}.Answer:abcabcaabcac,abcabcabcbc,

user: A group of friends went to the cinema. They sat in three groups consisting of three seats each. Everyone sat in the same position than in the last time. Now, you have to write a program that will accept a group name (for example: group1) and a list of groups and check if there is a same position in two lists. If two of the groups are the same, the program returns true. Answer:abcaaaabcbcbaabccaaabbbabc,abbbcababcccabccbcaabbbacbbc

expected_answer: Answer: Amir, Raj, Wei, Kim, Moin
